abstract: Web 2.0 offers a direct, more trusted line of communications than anything that came before it.
snippet: Web 2.0 offers a direct, more trusted line of communications than anything that came before it.
lead_paragraph: At a conference for the public-relations industry a couple weeks ago, I was asked to speak about Web 2.0—those interactive Web sites where we, the public, supply the material (Facebook, MySpace, Craigslist, eBay, YouTube, Flickr, TripAdvisor, and so on, not to mention blogs, podcasts and amateur video).

headline.main: Are You Taking Advantage of Web 2.0?
headline.kicker: From the Desk of David Pogue
